list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.AsyncResult#Result
list.description: Result value. Can be any type, each method may put there appropriate object which before was returned directly.Null if request was unsuccessful.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.AsyncResult#Status
list.description: Status of HTTP response retrieved either from Result or Error objects

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager
list.description: This class provides methods for opening documents for editing directly from server and saving back to serverwithout download and upload steps. This includes editing Microsoft Office documents as well as any other filetypes and works on Windows, Mac OS X and Linux.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.DavProtocolEditDocument
list.description:
Opens document for editing or printing using davX: protocol and prompts to install the protocol it if not found.

The following functionality is supported in v3 Beta and later only:

This function supports both challenge-response authentication (Basic, Digest, NTLM, Kerberos) and cookies authentication. If 'None' is specified in the sSearchIn parameter the challenge-response authentication is used, otherwise cookies authentication is used.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.EditDocument
list.description:
Opens document for editing. In case of Microsoft Office documents, it will try to use Microsoft Office protocols first. If Microsoft Office protocols are not found it will use davX: protocol and prompt to install it if not found.

This function supports only challenge-response authentication (Basic, Digest, NTLM, Kerberos). You can also use it to open MS Office documents from servers with MS-OFBA authentication.

This function does NOT support cookies authentication. If your server is using cookies authentication use the DavProtocolEditDocument() function instead.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.GetProtocolInstallFileNames
list.description: Gets file names of the protocol installer depending on OS.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.GSuiteEditDocument
list.description: Edit MS Office document with G Suite Online Editor.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.GSuitePreviewDocument
list.description: Preview MS Office document with G Suite Online Tool.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.IsDavProtocolSupported
list.description: Returns true if protocol application installer is supported for the OS on which this function is called, false - otherwise.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.IsGSuiteDocument
list.description: Extracts extension and returns true if the document can be edited in G Suite editor or document preview generated via G Suite.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.IsMicrosoftOfficeDocument
list.description: Extracts extension and returns true if URL points to Microsoft Office Document.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.MicrosoftOfficeEditDocument
list.description: Opens Microsoft Office document using protocol. This method does not offer protocol installation if protocol is not found. Microsoft Office must be installed on a client machine.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.MsOfficeEditExtensions
list.description: Collection of extensions of files which are opened with Microsoft Office.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.OpenFolderInOsFileManager
list.description:
Mounts folder in file system and opens it in default OS file manger. Requests protocol installation if folder opening protocol is not installed.

The following functionality is supported in v3 Beta and later only:

This function supports both challenge-response authentication (Basic, Digest, NTLM, Kerberos) and cookies authentication. If 'None' is specified in the sSearchIn parameter the challenge-response authentication is used, otherwise cookies authentication is used.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.DocManager.ProtocolTimeoutMs
list.description: Timeout in milliseconds to call error callback if application associated with the extension did not start.Default is 3000ms.Used in Chrome / Internet Explorer / Safari if protocol application is not installed AND web browser protocol warning dialog is disabled AND EditDocument() / MicrosoftOfficeEditDocument() function is called (in case of Basic/Digest/Anonymous authentication).NOT used in Firefox / Edge OR if DavProtocolEditDocument() is called OR if web browser protocol warning dialog is enabled.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus
list.description: Structure that describes HTTP response's status.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.BadGateway
list.description: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from the upstreamserver it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.BadRequest
list.description: The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed syntax. The client SHOULD NOT repeatthe request without modifications.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Conflict
list.description: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Created
list.description: The request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.DependencyFailed
list.description: The method could not be performed on the resource because the requested action depended on anotheraction and that action failed.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Forbidden
list.description: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.InsufficientStorage
list.description: The method could not be performed on the resource because the server is unable to store therepresentation needed to successfully complete the request.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Locked
list.description: The source or destination resource of a method is locked.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.MethodNotAllowed
list.description: The method specified in the Request-Line is not allowed for the resource identified by the Request-URI.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.MultiStatus
list.description: This status code provides status for multiple independent operations.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.NoContent
list.description: The server has fulfilled the request but does not need to return an entity-body, and might want toreturn updated meta information.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.None
list.description: No status defined.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.NotFound
list.description: The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.NotImplemented
list.description: The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.OK
list.description: The request has succeeded.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Parse
list.description: Parses HttpStatus structure from string containing status information.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.PartialContent
list.description: The server has fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.PreconditionFailed
list.description: The precondition given in one or more of the request-header fields evaluated to false when it was testedon the server.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Redirect
list.description: This status code is used instead if 302 redirect. This is because 302 code is processed automaticallyand there is no way to process redirect to login page.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus.Unauthorized
list.description: The request requires user authentication.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#Equals
list.description: Indicates whether the current HttpStatus structure is equal to another HttpStatus structure.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsCopyMoveOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Copy or Move operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsCreateOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Create operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsDeleteOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Delete operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsGetOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Get operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsHeadOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Head operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsPutOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Put operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsSuccess
list.description: Returns true if status is successful.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsUnlockOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Unlock operation.

list.title: ITHit.WebDAV.Client.HttpStatus#IsUpdateOk
list.description: Returns true if status is successful for Proppatch operation.
